IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: As an independent college preparatory school, our mission is to provide an environment in which students strive to achieve their highest academic goals and to build character through a balanced program of academics, the arts and athletics.
IRS990.MissionDesc: As an independent college preparatory school, our mission is to provide an environment in which students strive to achieve their highest academic goals and to build character through a balanced program of academics, the arts and athletics.
IRS990.Desc: located in sarasota, florida, the out-of-door academy provides two unique educational environments proven to produce exceptional results: the historic setting of its lower school (grades prek-5) on siesta key, and the collegiate-style uihlein campus at lakewood ranch (grades 6-12). the out-of-door academy has been the educational leader in the greater sarasota community for over 90 years. we continue to set a standard of excellence recognized by the best colleges and universities across the nation. ranked by the cum laude society in the top 1% of all secondary schools in the nation, we are proud to be known for providing an outstanding education that inspires students to reach their true potential and pursue their dreams.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE FUTURE FINANCIAL STABILITY FOR THE SCHOOL.

Out-of-Door Academy of Sarasota, Inc. is exempt from federal income tax under Section 501 (c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. The School is also exempt from state income tax under Chapter 220.13 of the Florida Statutes. The School considers items that may be subject to tax as unrelated trade or business income each year and files the appropriate exempt organization business income tax return. The items primarily subject to such consideration were the cell tower lease agreement. Theamount of tax related to unrelated trade or business income was $21,785 in 2018.The School has adopted guidance issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) on accounting for uncertainty in tax positions. Management believes the School has no material unrecognized income tax liabilities, including any potential loss of its tax exempt status. The School has no ongoing federal, state or local tax audits; however, the School's tax returns for the three previous fiscal years remain open to examination.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Non-discrimination policy is included in the organizations admission materials.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: financial assistance is awarded based on need. families are required to complete the following application components:1) income tax return with W-2 forms2) SSS parent financial statement (pfs)3) out-of-door supplementary financial assistance form (sfaf)the pfs is a third party form which collects financial data, used in part, to determine financial aid eligibility. the pfs uses a multitude of financial factors that include family income, assets, liabilities, age of parents and extraordinary expenses. the combination of results from the pfs and sfaf are used to determine need. a final award is determined by the out-of-door financial assistance committee. Additionally, full-time faculty and staff employed prior to January 14, 2016 are eligible for tuition remission, an employee benefit. this discount is provided at a level of 50% to 75% depending upon hire date.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organizations written employment contract includes an annual travel allowance and an annual vehicle expense for the Head of the School and his family. During the 2017/18 fiscal year, the amounts expensed totaled $9,278. The head of the school's wife is also expected to participate in certain professional growth opportunities that may involve travel expense. None of these benefits are taxable compensation to the employee.
Schedule K, Part IV, Line 2C Rebate computation was performed on October 16, 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is reviewed by the CFO and discussed with the Finance Committee. the 990 is distributed to the full board of TRUSTEES for discussion prior to finalization and submission to the irs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the current policy covers all trustees. the executive committee makes the determination of whether a reported trustee conflict would be detrimental to a person's continued service on the board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: benchmarking data from index, nais and fcis are used to determine appropriate compensation for all employees. In addition to this benchmarking data, the board chair and executive committee are involved in determining the compensation plan for the head of the school. Top management compensation plans are determined by the head of the school.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the organization makes its financial statements, conflict of interest policy and governing documents available to the public upon request. copies of the organization's tax returns can also be found at www.guidestar.org.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Increases
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Change in Fair Value of Interest Rate Swap = $12403
